intro: Agrostis muelleri var. paludosa, commonly known as the wetland bentgrass, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has slender,丛生的 stems that produce small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to yellowish flowers. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in humid environments. This variety is valued for its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
